patterns.name: Procrastination Patterns
patterns.description: When, why, and how tasks get delayed

patterns.name: Focus & Attention
patterns.description: When focus is strong vs fragmented, hyperfocus triggers

evidence.observation: Focus is strong in mornings but can be derailed by phone/social media use
evidence.context: Direct user report about focus patterns

patterns.name: Energy Management
patterns.description: Daily energy fluctuations, peak performance times, crashes

evidence.observation: Peak energy and productivity in the morning
evidence.context: Direct user report about daily patterns

patterns.name: Time Perception
patterns.description: How User experiences and estimates time, time blindness patterns

patterns.name: Task Initiation
patterns.description: What helps User start tasks, executive dysfunction triggers

evidence.observation: Easier to start new tasks and those aligned with interests - classic interest-based nervous system

patterns.name: Motivation Patterns
patterns.description: What drives User (interest, urgency, importance, novelty)

evidence.observation: Strong motivation for novel tasks and activities that interest them
evidence.context: Direct discussion about task initiation preferences

patterns.name: Environmental Factors
patterns.description: How surroundings affect productivity (noise, clutter, location)

patterns.name: Stress Response
patterns.description: How User reacts to pressure, overwhelm patterns, coping mechanisms

patterns.name: Social Patterns
patterns.description: Social battery, communication preferences, people-related energy

patterns.name: Sleep & Routine
patterns.description: Sleep patterns, morning/evening preferences, routine adherence

patterns.name: Emotional Regulation
patterns.description: Emotional patterns, RSD sensitivity, mood impacts on productivity

patterns.name: Decision Making
patterns.description: How User makes choices, decision fatigue, analysis paralysis

patterns.name: Transitions & Switching
patterns.description: Difficulty switching tasks, context switching, transition times

patterns.name: Sensory Preferences
patterns.description: Sensory sensitivities, stimulation needs, sensory seeking/avoidance

patterns.name: Hyperfocus Patterns
patterns.description: What triggers hyperfocus, how it manifests, post-hyperfocus crash

patterns.name: Accountability Response
patterns.description: How User responds to check-ins, external vs internal motivation

patterns.name: Learning Style
patterns.description: How User learns best, information retention, skill acquisition

patterns.name: Rejection Sensitivity
patterns.description: RSD triggers, responses to criticism/perceived rejection, coping strategies

meta.notes: Initial 18 ADHD pattern categories. Confidence starts at 0 and increases as observations are collected.
